answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that may be helpful in answering your question.
This is an article from Incident Prevention about how to best prepare employees for taking over a foreman’s position. 
http://incident-prevention.com/component/k2/article/144.html
For more information on the type of exams associated with a foreman’s position promotion you could contact the cities below. I included a link to more information about that their testing process.
City of Utica, NY- General Foreman
http://www.cityofutica.com/pdf/civil_service/X-General%20Foreperson%20PROM%202012.pdf
City of Tonawanda, NY- Public Works Foreman
http://www.ci.tonawanda.ny.us/civilservice/PUBLICWORKSFOREPROM.pdf
This is a directory of study guides for various civil service exams in Louisiana. On page 15 it details what they recommend for Highway Foreman candidates and the elements of the test.
http://www.state.lib.la.us/empowerlibrary/csmanual10th.pdf
This page links to sample civil service questions use in Jefferson Parish, LA. 
http://www.jeffparish.net/jppd/index.cfm?DocID=11
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Robert Frank
text:
Our City's Street Maintenance Division has two Crew Leaders that manage specific repair and maintenance projects.  We will be facing the retirement of one of these crew leaders and are looking at our promotion process (hasn't been an issue for over a decade).  I would like any information on a promotion process for this position including a written test.  In many communities this may be described as a foreman's position.
You may email me directly at rjfrank@hazelwoodmo.org, my telephone number is 314-513-5012.  Thank you for any assistance that can be provided.
Robert Frank
title: Public Works - Street Maintenance Promotion Process
